title: Expert: Amazon closing domestic marketplace will not have significant influence in China
content:
(Photo/CCTV)
	As Amazonâs market share in China is relatively small, the decision to shut its domestic marketplace will not have a significant influence on Chinaâs overall e-commerce development, Li Yongjian, an expert with the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences (CASS) said Thursday, China Central Television's economic news channel (CCTV-2) reported on April 18.
	Amazon.com Inc said on April 18 that it would close its online stores in China by July 18. Meanwhile, it will no longer operate a marketplace, nor provide third-party seller services on Amazon.cn, as the company plans to focus on the more profitable business of selling overseas goods and cloud services in China, according to Reuters.
	âAlthough itâs a pity that Amazon made this decision, they will continue with overseas goods, which is where their core competitiveness lies,â said a Chinese consumer surnamed Gao.
	Since 2016, Chinaâs e-commerce development has entered into a period of rapid expansion, and has since witnessed a soaring growth rate of 20 to 30 percent, said Li, director of the research department of Internet economy under the National Academy of Economic Strategy, CASS.
	âOur e-commerce penetration rate has exceeded 70 percent,â added Li, explaining this is typical of e-commerce development in China.
	âAs to Amazon, some of its services will probably exit the Chinese market, and the first one should be its local B2C services. As Amazonâs market share in the Chinese e-commerce market is not very big, the shift in business focus will not have too huge an influence on the overall e-commerce development in China,â said Li.
